body_html: I needed to adapt the test so they use np.float instead of np.float32, e. g. here. Isn't that a bit concerning? Shouldn't these types be equivalent? Or at least the op fall back to CPU if it's not supported on the GPU?
body_text: I needed to adapt the test so they use np.float instead of np.float32, e. g. here. Isn't that a bit concerning? Shouldn't these types be equivalent? Or at least the op fall back to CPU if it's not supported on the GPU?
body: I needed to adapt the test so they use `np.float` instead of `np.float32`, e. g. [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/1393/files#diff-bb1fdb8f5be7a85b4505589762579bf7R31). Isn't that a bit concerning? Shouldn't these types be equivalent? Or at least the op fall back to CPU if it's not supported on the GPU?
